properties.areaDesc: Wabash, IL; Daviess, IN; Knox, IN; Gibson, IN; Pike, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 2:02PM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
Flood Statement
National Weather Service Indianapolis IN
<INHDR_TIME>

...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

Big Blue River...Big Walnut Creek...Buck Creek...Driftwood River...
Eagle Creek...East Fork White River...Eel River...Flatrock River...
Mill Creek...Mississinewa River...Sugar Creek...Tippecanoe River...
Wabash River...White River...Youngs Creek...

.High river levels and some lowland flooding will occur along rivers
in western, central and southern Indiana. River levels will approach moderate
flood stage in some areas along the White and East Fork White rivers.

Between 2.5 to 3.5 inches of rain fell across western, central and southern Indiana over the last 48 hours. Light rain is expected to continue until later this afternoon. Dry weather is then expected to dominate the early parts of next week.

River levels will continue to rise over the next 24 hours as water drains into the river. Most rivers are expected to crest between Sunday evening and Monday morning. Please see below for specific river level forecasts for each site.

The Flood Warning continues for
The White River at Petersburg.
* until further notice.
* At  1:30 PM Saturday the stage was 19.4 feet.
* Flood stage is 16.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...It will continue rising to near 25.0 feet by late
Thursday night then begin falling.
* At 25.0 feet...A very significant flood is in progress.  Emergency
flood fighting may be needed.  Evacuations would begin from river
cabins in Dodge City.  Livestock must be moved.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
